citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The inspector arrived at the facility gate at 12:05pm. When the inspector contacted the facility representative to conduct
the inspection, he informed the inspector that he was not at the facility. The facility representative said that he was not
planning to renew his license and the inspector stated that he currently still has an active license which requires routine
unannounced inspections. It was established that volunteers were present at the facility and the inspector confirmed that
they would be suitable to conduct the inspection in his stead. The facility representative then questioned multiple times
whether maintaining a license was still necessary for the facility and the inspector discussed what constituted regulated
activity. During this conversation, the facility representative became increasingly agitated. By the end of this discussion,
the facility representative said that he would not allow the inspector on the property. When the inspector said that it would
be a refusal which is very serious, the facility representative reiterated that he would not authorize the inspector to do the
inspection with the volunteers.
Allowing inspectors to conduct inspections is a requirement of all licensed facilities under the Animal Welfare Act.
Refusing inspection inhibits the regulatory process and prevents inspectors from assessing animal health and welfare,
and prevents the Secretary from fulfilling his obligation to enforce the Animal Welfare Act. Correct immediately by allowing
inspectors to conduct inspections during normal business hours.
The inspection was refused, no exit interview was conducted.
